conclusion: The process from A to B is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
The work done by the gas in an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV.
The pressure at state A is P_A = 1 × 10^5 Pa (as indicated on the graph).
The volume at state A is V_A = 3 L.
The volume at state B is V_B = 4 L.
The change in volume ΔV = V_B - V_A = 4 L - 3 L = 1 L.
Convert the volume change into cubic meters: 1 L = 0.001 m³.
Calculate work using W = P ΔV: W = (1 × 10^5 Pa) × (0.001 m³) = 100 J.
Since the volume increases, the gas does work on the surroundings.
The work done by the gas is +100 J.
The work done externally by the gas from state A to state B is 100 J.
